analysis.key_quote: The Schedule F designation undermines the core principles established by the Pendleton Civil Service Reform Act of 1883, which created a merit-based system to insulate federal hiring from political patronage.
analysis.rationale: The comment explicitly opposes the proposed rule by highlighting its threats to the integrity and apolitical nature of the civil service, as well as concerns about due process and merit-based hiring, which are central to the opposition against politicization.
